request.description:
## Add an order to the database

You can send a `POST` request to the `/orders` endpoint to create a new order and add it to the `orders` database. Open the body tab, edit the JSON object to match the item you want to add an order of, then click `Send`.

![Add order](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/5029719/76755799-6b2df100-677c-11ea-8605-8f8b948de90e.png)

> Since this sample API is built using a mock server, the same object will be added regardless of what you enter.

body.raw:
{
    "companyName": "AmgadElsayedForCompanyCode",
    "companyCountryId": 65,
    "companyAddress": "No Address For Company Code",
    "companyEmail": "elsayed.mohammed70ForCompanyCode@gmail.com",
    "password": "123456",
    "confirmPassword": "123456",
    "userEmail": "elsayed.mohammed70ForCompanyCode@gmail.com",
    "userMobileNumber": "010254215478",
    "name": "Amgad Elsayed For Company Code",
    "agreed": true
}

item.description:
// this is status for ( entire row and in and out ) => 0 or 1 or 2 (success or warning or error )

public enum EmployeeAttendanceStatus  
{  
Success,  
Warning,  
Error  
}

---

// fingerprint response will be 0, or 1 => in or out

public enum FingerPrintType  
{  
CheckIn,  
CheckOut,  
BreakCheckIn,  
BreakCheckOut  
}

---

public enum EmployeeStatus  
{  
NotAttendYet,  
AtWork,  
AttendThenLeaved,  
LeavedOnly  
}

__________________________________________________________

public enum RecognitionWay  
{  
FingerPrint,  
FaceRecognition,  
VoiceRecognition,  
PaternRecognition,  
PinRecognition,  
PasswordRecognition  
}

public enum RequestType  
{  
Assignment,  
Justifications,

}

}
